title: 12.4 A dedicated follower of fashion - b34
description: Deze les valt onder de arrangeerbare leerlijn van de Stercollecties voor Engels voor vmbo beroepsgerichte leerweg, leerjaar 3 en 4. Dit is thema 12 'Fashion'. Het onderwerp van deze les is: A dedicated follower of fashion. In deze les staat kleding die in de mode is centraal, waarbij er gesproken wordt over productie en aankoop van spijkerbroeken, mode slachtoffers en gevaarlijke modetrends. De onregelmatige werkwoorden in deze les zijn: to show, to sing en to sit. In de grammaticaopdracht worden de bijvoeglijke naamwoorden en bijwoorden behandeld.

items.content:
Het onderwerp van dit blok is kleding die in de mode is.

  • Maak groepjes van drie of vier leerlingen.

Bespreek de volgende vragen in jouw groepje:

  • Wat vind jij van spijkerbroeken?
  • Wat weet jij van de stof waarvan spijkerbroeken gemaakt worden?
  • Welke mode-items zijn ongemakkelijk om te dragen?
  • Zijn er kledingstukken die gevaarlijk zijn om te dragen?

Bekijk hieronder de stappen die je gaat zetten.

Succes.

Step

aim

introduction

Nadenken over wat je al weet.

10

Step 1

listening
How jeans are made

Je kunt een video over het maken van spijkerbroeken begrijpen en er vragen over beantwoorden.

15

Step 2

Je kunt een tekst over gevaarlijke modetrends begrijpen en er vragen over beantwoorden.

vocabulary and irregular verbs

Je leert vocabulaire over mode en kunt die gebruiken. De onregelmatige werkwoorden: to show, to sing en to sit.

15

Step 4

Je kunt de bijvoeglijke naamwoorden en bijwoorden gebruiken.

Talking about fashion and clothes

Je kunt discussiëren over kleding.

10

Step 6

An email to H & M

Je kunt een e-mail schrijven waarin je klaagt over de aankoop van een spijkerbroek.

Nadenken over wat je geleerd hebt.

5

Step 8

extra
A dedicated follower of fashion

How jeans are made

Je gaat een video bekijken over hoe jeans (spijkerbroeken) worden gemaakt.

  • Kijk naar de eerste twee minuten van de video en maak assignment 1.
  • Lees de vragen.
  • Kijk nu de hele video vanaf het begin en maak assignment 2.

Assignment 1

Kijk naar de eerste twee minuten van de video en beantwoord onderstaande vragen eerst zelf. Bespreek de vragen daarna in je groepje.

  • Which countries are mentioned?
  • What is the first thing to do in the process of making jeans?

prompt.body:
Choose the right answer to the question.

When were jeans invented?

content.body: He began making miners denim work pants.
He began selling miners denim work pants.
He began designing miners denim work pants.

prompt.body: How many pairs of jeans are sold in the US every year?
In which country is this video recorded?
What is said about the mechanical cotton picker?

content.body: It picks in 5 minutes what a human picks in a whole day.
It picks in 5 minutes more than a human picks in a whole day.
It picks in 5 minutes less than a human picks in a whole day.

prompt.body: What or who is the Cotton King?

content.body: It's the owner of the cotton factory.
It's a machine that dries and cleans the harvest of cotton.

prompt.body: What do they do in the Denimar factory?

content.body: They turn cotton into bails ready for transport.

prompt.body: What information do you get about the dye?

content.body: It starts yellow and turns blue when it comes in contact with water.
It starts yellow and turns blue when it comes in contact with oxygen.
It starts yellow and turns blue when it comes in contact with indigo.

prompt.body: How much cloth do you need to make a pair of jeans?

content.body: He is the pattern cutter in the jeans factory.
He is the pattern designer in the jeans factory.
He is the pattern layer in the jeans factory.

prompt.body: What is the job of Marie Cruz?

items.content:
Fashion victims

You are going to read a text about fashion victims.
Je gaat een tekst lezen over mode slachtoffers.

  • Read the text and do assignment 1.
    Lees de tekst en maak opdracht 1.
  • Read the text again and do assignment 2.
    Lees de tekst nog een keer en maak opdracht 2.

Assignment 1

Do the assignment on your own, then discuss your answers in your group.
Doe de opdracht eerst zelf. Bespreek daarna je antwoorden in je groep.

Write down the 5 most important words from the paragraphs.

Introduction

Corsets

Stiff collars

Killer heels

Fashion victims: History's most dangerous trends
By Fiona Macdonald, 24 June 2015

Giving new meaning to the phrase 'fashion victim', a 35-year-old Australian woman had to be cut out of a pair of skinny jeans after developing a condition called compartment syndrome.

It's not the first time someone has succumbed to a dangerous style trend: "They've always been around, since the Stone Ages," says Summer Strevens, the author of Fashionably Fatal. "It's when fashion is taken to an extreme; I call it vanity insanity." Here are three of the deadliest fads in history.


Corsets
The undergarment that shrank waistlines long before Spanx had an influence on language as much as women's bodies: it spawned the term 'strait-laced', lending a Victorian respectability to its wearer, as well as 'loose women' - implying that those who were corset-less had morals as free as their lacing. In her book, Strevens says that "corsets caused indigestion, constipation, frequent fainting from difficulty in breathing and even internal bleeding… inhibited breathing, giving rise to the Victorian 'heaving bosom', was indicative of pressure upon the lungs, while the other internal organs, forced to shift from their natural position to accommodate the new skeletal shape, were subject to damage." In 1874, a list was published attributing 97 diseases to corset wearing, including heightened hysteria and melancholy; between the late 1860s and the early 1890s, Strevens says, the medical journal The Lancet published at least an article a year on the medical dangers of tight lacing. And it didn't end with breathing difficulties or organ damage: in 1903, 42-year-old mother-of-six Mary Halliday died abruptly after a seizure. The New York Times reported that during her autopsy, "two pieces of corset steel were found in her heart, their total length being eight and three-quarter inches. Where they rubbed together the ends were worn to a razor edge by the movement of her body."

Stiff collars
Invented in the 19th Century, the detachable collar meant men didn't have to change their shirt every day. It was also starched to a stiffness that proved lethal. "They were called 'father killer', or 'Vatermörder' in German," says Strevens. "They could cut off the blood supply to the carotid artery. Edwardian men would wear them as a fashion accessory - they'd go to their gentleman's club, have a few glasses of port and nod off in a winged armchair, with their heads tilted forward. They actually suffocated." One 1888 obituary in The New York Times was headlined 'Choked by his collar': a man called John Cruetzi had been found dead in a park, and "the Coroner thought the man had been drinking, seated himself on a bench, and fell asleep. His head dropped over on his chest and then his stiff collar stopped the windpipe and checked the flow of blood through the already contracted veins, causing the death to ensue from asphyxia and apoplexy."

Killer heels
Said to have been inspired by a 10th Century court dancer who wrapped her feet in silk to perform for the Emperor, Chinese foot-binding was officially banned in 1912. Yet some continued the practice - a means of displaying status, revealing that a woman didn't need her feet to work - in secret. The British photographer Jo Farrell has documented the last surviving women with bound feet for her Living History project. She told the BBC: "I feel so many people talk about how barbaric the tradition was, but it was also a tradition that empowered women. It gave them a better life… one of the most important things that came across was that they have a pride in what happened to them." Reshaping feet is not restricted to China, however - according to Strevens, "in earlier centuries, ladies of fashion were known to have had their 'little' toes amputated, slipping their feet into ever-more-pointed fashionable footwear". She argues that while historic practices might sound barbaric, women today are still enduring pain for fashion, referencing "the contemporary vogue for the surgical shortening, even amputation of healthy toes, in order to fit into today's sky-high stilettos". There are still plenty of fashion victims in the 21st Century. "Although we haven't got corsets any more, there are now people having their ribs removed to get a smaller waist."

prompt.body: A 35-year-old woman from Austria needed to be cut out of her skinny jeans.
Women who didn't wear corsets were said to have very free morals.
A list of ninety-six diseases caused by corset wearing was published.
The detachable collar was invented in the eighteenth Century.
Jo Farrell has made a documentary about the last surviving women with bound feet.
Some women even have their 'little' toes amputated to be able to wear fashionable shoes.

items.content:
Bestudeer de woordenlijst.

Woordenlijst A dedicated follower of fashion


Tip!
Er zijn verschillende manieren om woordjes te leren.
Je kunt de woorden hardop voorlezen of overschrijven.
Het belangrijkste is dat je dit niet te lang achter elkaar doet, want dan leer je niets meer.
In twee keer 10 minuten leer je meer dan in een half uur.

Irregular Verbs

Bestudeer de volgende drie irregular verbs (onregelmatige werkwoorden):

  • to show
  • to sing
  • to sit

hele werkwoord

past simple

voltooid deelwoord

Nederlands

to show

showed

shown

laten zien

to sing

sang

sung

zingen

to sit

sat

sat

zitten


Doe de opdrachten.

content.body:
Sleep de woorden naar de juiste plaats in de tabel.

Nothing fits so well as a pair of denim jeans.

Niets zo goed als een spijkerbroek.

Picking cotton by hand is backbreaking work.

Met de hand plukken is slopend werk.

To make a consistent thread the cotton needs to be blended.

Om een regelmatige te krijgen moet het katoen gemengd worden.

To make jeans blue the cotton first has to be dyed.

Om spijkerbroeken blauw te maken moet het katoen eerst worden.

Indigo blue dye isn't water soluble.

Indigo blauwe verfstof is niet in water.

As soon as the cotton comes in contact with oxygen it turns blue.

Zodra het katoen in aanraking komt met wordt het blauw.

Because the bond between the dye and cotton isn't very strong jeans gradually fade.

Omdat de verbinding tussen verfstof en katoen niet erg sterk is spijkerbroeken geleidelijk.

The pattern is printed onto paper.

Het wordt op papier afgedrukt.

Do you know any fashion victims?

Ken jij ?

It's not the first time someone has succumbed to a dangerous style trend.

Het is niet de eerste keer dat iemand is aan een gevaarlijke modetrend.

I call it vanity insanity.

Ik noem het gekte.

A corset is an undergarment to shrink the waistline.

Een korset is die je taille vermindert.

An article was published on the medical dangers of thight lacing.

Er is een artikel gepubliceerd over de medische gevaren van .

In the 19th Century men wore detachable collars.

In de 19e eeuw droegen mannen afneembare .

The collars were starched to a stiffness that proved lethal.

De kragen werden zo stijf dat ze dodelijk bleken te zijn.

In the 10th Century a court dancer wrapped her feet in silk.

In de 10e eeuw wikkelde een hofdanseres haar voeten in .

This was a way of displaying status.

Dit was een manier om status te .

What footwear do you prefer?

Aan welk geef jij de voorkeur?

Vertaal het onderstreepte woord in het Nederlands.

The pattern is printed onto paper.
What footwear do you prefer?
Indigo blue dye isn't water soluble.
In the 10th Century a court dancer wrapped her feet in silk.
A corset is an undergarment to shrink the waistline.
To make a consistent thread the cotton needs to be blended.
In the 19th Century men wore detachable collars.

Vul de ontbrekende werkwoordsvormen in.

items.content:
Adjectives and adverbs

In dit thema herhalen we de bijvoeglijke naamwoorden en bijwoorden.
De meeste informatie die je hier krijgt heb je in vorige jaren al geleerd.

  • Lees de uitleg in de kennisbank.
  • Maak opdracht 1.
Adjectives and adverbs

content.body:
Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

My cousin helped me paint the walls. He's done it very . (nice)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

Mum always dresses . (beautiful)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

He felt so he stayed at home. (sick)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

The doctor said that that the wound looked very . (bad)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

Have you been to the cinema ? (late)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

The boys always greet in a way. (friendly)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

I've finished writing the book. (near)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

He is a intelligent boy, probably the best in the class. (high)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

The girls wore coloured skirts. (bright)

Fill in the correct form: adjective or adverb.

The headmaster has a very voice. (loud)

items.content:
Talking about fashion and clothes

Choose five questions to discuss in your group.

  1. What kind of clothes do you like best?
  2. Do you have a favorite type of fabric?
  3. Are a lot of your clothes one color or pattern?
  4. What's your favorite place to shop? Why?
  5. Are you a price conscious shopper?
  6. What was the last thing you bought for yourself? Where did you buy it?
    Why did you buy it?
  7. When you buy something, do you read the label? Why or why not?
  8. How important is it for you to be up to date with the latest fashions?
  9. Do you compare prices at different stores when you shop?
  10. Is it important for you to own designer clothes? Why or why not?

An email to H & M

Je hebt tijdens je vakantie in London bij H&M een spijkerbroek gekocht. Het was eigenlijk best wel een dure broek, maar je vond hem mooi en wilde hem graag hebben. Na de eerste keer wassen kwam de broek kapot uit de wasmachine.

Je was behoorlijk teleurgesteld. Dit is je nog nooit overkomen met een broek die je in Nederland bij H&M hebt gekocht.
Je besluit een e-mail te sturen naar de afdeling klantenservice.

  • Maak de schrijfopdracht.
  • Schrijf een e-mail.
  • Lever je e-mail in bij je docent.

Omdat je niet weet of de geadresseerde (medewerker klantenservice) een man of een vrouw is richt je de e-mail aan: Dear Sir/ Madam

Verwerk de volgende punten:

  • Stel jezelf voor (naam, leeftijd, jongen/meisje, woonplaats, land).
  • Vertel waarom je e-mail schrijft. (Je hebt een klacht over een spijkerbroek).
  • Schrijf waar je de spijkerbroek gekocht hebt en hoe duur hij was.
  • Vertel wat er met de spijkerbroek gebeurd is.
  • Zeg dat dit je in Nederland nog nooit is overkomen, omdat H&M kwaliteit levert.
  • Vraag of je je geld terug kunt krijgen.
  • Schrijf een passend slot.
  • Zet je naam onder de e-mail.

Vul het schema in en beantwoord de vragen onder het schema.

Activiteit leuk niet leuk makkelijk moeilijk weet ik al nieuw
Listening

Vocabulary
Grammar

Writing

  • Waar moet ik nog aan werken?
  • Wat moet ik nog aan mijn docent vragen?

A dedicated follower of fashion

You are going to listen to the song A dedicated follower of fashion.
Je gaat luisteren naar het lied A dedicated follower of fashion.

  • Luister naar het liedje.
  • Vorm groepen van drie of vier leerlingen.
  • Bespreek het lied. Waar gaat het over? Wat is een dedicated follower of fashion?
